references.paper_title: Attend-and-excite: Attention-based semantic guidance for text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This paper proposes a method for improving the quality of text-to-image generation by incorporating attention mechanisms, which is a key aspect of the CIDM model proposed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Dreambooth: Fine tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation
references.reason: This paper introduces Dreambooth, a technique for fine-tuning text-to-image diffusion models to generate images of specific subjects, which is directly relevant to the concept of personalized concept customization explored in the main paper.

This paper addresses the challenge of customizing text-to-image diffusion models for multiple concepts simultaneously, a problem directly tackled by the incremental approach described in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Mix-of-show: Decentralized low-rank adaptation for multi-concept customization of diffusion models
references.reason: This paper proposes a low-rank adaptation method for multi-concept customization in diffusion models, which is a key technique used in the CIDM model to efficiently handle multiple concepts.
This paper introduces a lifelong learning approach for text-to-image diffusion models, which is highly relevant to the continual adaptation setting addressed by the CIDM model in this work.
